intro: Phyllostephanus, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. Native to southern Africa, these plants thrive in well-drained, acidic soils and full sun to partial shade. Phyllostephanus species are often used in horticulture for their ornamental value and ability to form dense, compact shrubs. They are also valued for their adaptability to various climate conditions and low maintenance requirements.
